item.title: Report E-2025030467
item.description:
Report E-2025030467

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 27, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1903 was punctured by a nail in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the released material in one (1) 15-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER PICKED UP THE LEAKING AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. RESPONDER NOTED THAT 2 OF 4 BOTTLES WERE MISSING CAPS/LIDS.

item.title: Report X-2025031388
item.description:
Report X-2025031388

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP AND DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE; CORROSIVE LIQUID, TOXIC, N.O.S. (SULPHURIC ACID, PHOSPHORIC ACID) - 2 GALLON JERRICAN INSIDE THE BOX. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECSION TREE GUIDLINES AND PH TEST LED TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL ACCORDING TO THE RESPONSE PAGE AND BROUGHT LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP.
